Part D: ArXiv.org - Preprint archive for research dissemination

About arXiv.org
Open-access research platform: arXiv.org hosts over two million scholarly articles across eight subject areas.
Pioneer in digital scholarship: Founded by Paul Ginsparg in 1991, maintained by Cornell Tech.
Fields covered: Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Quantitative Biology, Quantitative Finance, Statistics, Electrical Engineering & Systems Science, and Economics.
Services for researchers: Article submission, retrieval, search & discovery, web distribution, API access, content curation, and preservation.
Moderation process: Submissions are checked for topical relevance and scholarly value; material is not peer-reviewed.
Community and governance: Curated by volunteer moderators and guided by arXiv Leadership Team and advisory councils.
Free submission: Registered users may submit articles without fees.

arXiv.org

articles.title: Day 2
articles.contents:
SESSION 1: Reference Management & Literature Organization (50 minutes)
Part A: Zotero for Research Management
Literature search platforms
🗂️ Google Scholar
🗂️ Lens.org
🗂️ ConnectedPapers
Set Up Zotero

Download and Install Zotero (Recommended before the workshop)
Go to Zotero.org/download
Download Zotero Desktop (Windows, macOS, or Linux).
Install the software on your computer Video Instructions.

Install the Zotero Connector (Recommended before the workshop)
Download the Zotero Connector for your browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Safari).
This lets you save references directly from websites, databases, and Google Scholar.

Create a Zotero Account (Recommended before the workshop)
Go to Zotero.org
Sign up for a free account (needed for syncing your library across devices).

Sync Your Library (Recommended before the workshop)
Open the Zotero desktop app.
Go to Edit → Preferences → Sync.
Enter your Zotero account details and enable syncing.

Sync Your Library (Recommended before the workshop)
Open the Zotero desktop app.
Go to Edit → Preferences → Sync.
Enter your Zotero account details and enable syncing.

Sync Your Library (Recommended before the workshop)
Open the Zotero desktop app.
Go to Edit → Preferences → Sync.
Enter your Zotero account details and enable syncing.

Sync Your Library (Recommended before the workshop)
Open the Zotero desktop app.
Go to Edit → Preferences → Sync.
Enter your Zotero account details and enable syncing.
👩🏻‍💻 Zotero-ში დაამატე სამეცნიერო წყაროების (და არამარტო) ბიბლიოგრაფიული ინფორმაცია
🧑‍💻 შექმენი საქაღალდე [Collection]
👩🏻‍💻 ციტირება Microsoft Word-ში
🧑‍💻 ციტირება Google Docs-ში
ლიტერატურა
{{< spoiler text=“ძირითადი ლიტერატურა” >}}
📘 ლია წულაძე. სოციოლოგიური კვლევის თვისებრივი მეთოდები. უნივერსიტეტის გამომცემლობა. 2020. გვ., 365 – 369;
📘 ჩავა ფრანკფორტ-ნაჩმიასი, დევიდ ნაჩმიასი. კვლევის მეთოდები სოციალურ მეცნიერებებში. ილია ჭავჭავაძის უნივერსიტეტის გამომცემლობა. თბილისი 2008. გვ., 744 – 746;
📘 თემურ გუგუშვილი, ნინო პავლიაშვილი, გვანცა სალუქვაძე, მერაბ ხოხობაია, შემთხვევის შესწავლის ტრანსდისციპლინური საველე კურსის შემუშავება და განხორციელება, 2020. 57 – 60.
{{< /spoiler >}}
📚 ელ. ბიბლიოთეკა
რესურსები
ლიტერატურის მიმოხილვის დროს დაშვებული შეცდომები
{{< youtube IJDS0eXBwbg >}}
სტატია
SESSION 2: Data Collection and Analysis & AI-Enhanced Literature Review (70 minutes)
Part A: Kobotoolbox for Data Collection
Part B: MAXQDA for Qualitative Research Analysis
Part C: AI-Enhanced Literature Review
STORM (Stanford) - AI research assistant for comprehensive
literature reviews
NotebookLM.google - AI-powered literature review and synthesis
Individual Work Session:
- Account setup and first notebook creation
- Upload research papers and documents
- AI-assisted literature synthesis practice
- Q&A and Wrap-up

articles.title: JOPSCIP Workshop
articles.description: Digital Solutions for Research and E-portfolio!
articles.contents:
Welcome to JOPSCIP Workshop
Digital Solutions for Research and E-portfolio
This workshop provides comprehensive training and resources for modern research methodologies and digital portfolio development. Our expert facilitators bring extensive experience in academic research and digital innovation.
Meet Our Team



Temur Gugushvili

Associate Professor

IBSU & SCIEN


LinkedIn
Google Scholar



Gvantsa Salukvadze

___

SCIEN


LinkedIn
Google Scholar




Workshop Sessions:
Digital Identity: Building Your Digital Academic Identity
Project Management: Research Project Management & Communication
Literature Organization: Reference Management & Literature Organization
Data Handling: Data Collection and Analysis & AI-Enhanced
Literature Review
Getting Started
Ready to enhance your research capabilities? Explore our workshop Day 1 & Day 2 materials and connect with our team for personalized guidance on your digital research journey.
For questions or additional information, please contact on following email tgugushvili[at]ibsu.edu.ge, gvantsa.salukvadze[at]tsu.ge
